title: Font ID Request - Millionaire Price font
content:
Sorry for the unoriginal title. :( I’m looking for the name of this one font - it’s frustrating because I actually used to have it, until my computer’s hard drive went kaput (note to self: BACKUPS) and now I can’t remember what on earth it was called. I want to say it started with a “B”, but after browsing myfonts.com in the “B” category I didn’t see it. I might be thinking of another font though.

Anyways, it was used as the price font (that indicated question dollar amounts) on “Who Wants to be a Millionaire” (it’s not Copperplate Gothic, trust me) and it’s used in the screenshot below of a sign on James Cameron’s Titanic set.

Thanks in advance, and sorry for the poor quality / small screenshots. You can see the lettering, mostly the distinctive “E”, in the Titanic set shot, as well as where it says “LIFELINES” in the Millionaire screenie.

Thank you! :D

Titanic: [http://img299.imageshack.us/img299/3981/fontgrabij0.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20080603021508/http:/img299.imageshack.us/img299/3981/fontgrabij0.jpg "http://img299.imageshack.us/img299/3981/fontgrabij0.jpg")  
Millionaire: [http://img138.imageshack.us/img138/1993/whowantstobeamillionairpu7.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20080603021508/http:/img138.imageshack.us/img138/1993/whowantstobeamillionairpu7.jpg "http://img138.imageshack.us/img138/1993/whowantstobeamillionairpu7.jpg")

 [‹ House of 1000 Corpses / The Devil's Rejects](http://web.archive.org/web/20080603021508/http:/typophile.com/node/45926 "Go to previous forum topic") [Tech slab "MADLIB: TIGHTLIPPED" ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080603021508/http:/typophile.com/node/45918 "Go to next forum topic")
author: BandTrumpet7

comments.content:
Looks like it could be [Newtext](http://web.archive.org/web/20080603021508/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/ef/itc-newtext/).

- Mike Yanega

Thanks Mike, that’s the one!

I realized that the “B” font I was thinking of was Berthold Akzidenz-Grotesk - don’t know why I got the two confused, but at least problem solved.

Thanks!
